instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01041 no trackpad or keyboard
threads.message:
Arrived with L6700 blown up. Customer claims it smoked after changing battery. Replaced L6700 soldered direct to pin 1 of C6700 and a wire ran to pins 26 and 24 of J6700 but still no trackpad or keyboard. Also tried new trackpad.

What should be checked next??

threads.title: 820-01041 no trackpad or keyboard
threads.message:
What about pins 21 & 23 of J6701?
Do you get 5V_G3S on both connectors?

threads.title: 820-01041 no trackpad or keyboard
threads.message:
Yes 5V_G3S is present on both connectors.

Pins 21&23 of J6701 5.15V

threads.title: 820-01041 no trackpad or keyboard
threads.message:
This recently came back for the same problem. Trackpad and keyboard not working. After reseating cables trackpad is working again but still no keyboard.

5v present pins 26 24 and 23 on J6700

What should be checked next?

threads.title: 820-01041 no trackpad or keyboard
threads.message:
Keyboard I2C bus connects with trackpad.
You must test with known good keyboard, as it has embedded electronics.

threads.title: 820-01041 no trackpad or keyboard
threads.message:
Tried known good keyboard but still no change. Trackpad works but no response from keyboard.

What should be checked next??

threads.title: 820-01041 no trackpad or keyboard
threads.message:
Try good trackpad flex too.
Be sure to have good contacts at J6700.
Check voltage and diode mode to ground at I2C_KBD_SCL/SDA lines.
